title: ttf similar to "Arno pro caption"?
content:
Hello,

I am looking for a ttf font which has at least some resemblance to "Arno pro caption". It doesnt need to be very close!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110212131442im_/http:/typophile.com/files/trans1x1_6439.gif)

Of course a free font would be best (because I need it only once) but I would be willing to pay for one if no other option.

Why ttf? Because I want to export a document from OpenOffice into pdf (Open Office creates very solid, linked PDFs) and OpenOffice doesnt support otf in pdf.

Thank you very much for any ideas

PS.  
I tried uploading an image of the font ( [http://www.itcfonts.com/Assets/images/trans1x1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20110212131442/http:/www.itcfonts.com/Assets/images/trans1x1.gif "http://www.itcfonts.com/Assets/images/trans1x1.gif")) but didnt succeed.
author: gvzimmermann

comments.content:
Here it comes (the stupid website seems to try to stop you from copying samples, how stupid)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110212131442im_/http:/typophile.com/files/arnoSample_4664.jpg)

alisal, zapf renaissance, or classica

but you could also try to request a legacy format from Adobe... worth a try.

Mikey
Adobe allows the end users to modify a font, and that would include taking it from .otf to .ttf format. You might not get the features, but I don't believe Open Office supports them anyway, does it?
